result.execSummary:
The defendant Amadeo Nmi Leoni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Amadeo Nmi Leoni was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amadeo Nmi Leoni is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Amadeo Nmi Leoni was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Amadeo Nmi Leoni appeared. Case called at 8:35 a.m. Court reviews the file. Sentencing on Ct. 3. Court was presented with an email this a.m. with the victims statement. ADA McKinley gives sentencing argument. Atty Harrelson gives sentencing argument. DE gives statement. Appeal can be filed within 20 days Court orders:

- S/W 2 years probation. 

- Abide by the terms of the domestic abuse injunction

- Domestic abuse surcharge and $243.00 Misd. Court Costs. To be paid over the course of probation

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
Filed by Atty Harrelson. Requesting a continuance of 11/3/2015 SEH. Request denied. km

Sentencing hearing at 11-03-2015 08:30 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Webb. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Amadeo Nmi Leoni appeared.  Court called at 8:26 p.m.   *JURY TRIAL DAY 2*  Discussions outside the presence of the Jury.  Jury deliberated until 6:00 p.m. on DAY 1.   Recess at 8:28 a.m.  Case recalled at 10:25 a.m. outside the presence of the jury.  Jurors are requesting a transcript.  ADA Mckinley does not object.  Attorney Harrelson objects and gives argument.  Court will direct the jury to recall the witnesses testimony instead of using the transcript to recall testimony.  Recess at 10:27 a.m.  Jury in and case recalled at 1:06 p.m.  Verdict reached.  Jury finds DE Amadeo Leoni Not Guilty on Ct. 1 in the Criminal Complaint.  Jury Finds DE Amadeo Leoni Not Guilty on Gt. 2 in the Criminal Complaint.  Jury finds DE Amadeo Leoni Guilty on Ct. 3 in the Criminal Complaint.   Court polls the Jury.  Jury excused at 1:09 p.m.  Court will set out for SEH.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Amadeo Nmi Leoni appeared. JURY TRIAL  Case called at 9:26 a.m. with the jury present. Oath of Jurors as to Qualifications given at 9:28 a.m. Voir Dire by the court at 9:29 a.m. Statement of the case given by the court. Voir Dire by ADA McKinley 9:48 a.m. Voir Dire by Atty Harrelson at 10:09 a.m. Peremptory strike at 10:31 a.m. Jury selected at 10:32 a.m. Oath of Jurors for Trial given at 10:33 a.m. Court recesses at 10:35 a.m. Case recalled at 11:06 a.m. outside the presence of the jury. During the recess, the parties have been speaking regarding the transcripts regarding the family file. Atty Harrelson has advised the court regarding the portions of the transcripts that will be used. ADA McKinley notes objection.  Court will overrule the states objections. Case recalled at 11:12 a.m. with the jury present. Instructions given by the court. Opening statement by ADA McKinley 11:23 a.m. Opening statement by Atty Harrelson given at 11:30 a.m. ADA McKinley calls Deputy Turner to the stand. S/T Michael Turner. Deputy with St Croix County Sheriff's Office. Direct by ADA McKinley. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA McKinley. Witness excused at 11:41 a.m. State calls Deputy Stenseth to the stand. S/T Deputy Stenseth, Deputy with St Croix County Sheriff's Department. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness excused at 11:44 a.m. Jury excused at 11:45 a.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury at 11:45 a.m. Atty Harrelson addresses jury instructions. Court states will be taken up later. Court recesses at 11:46 a.m. Case recalled at 12:49 p.m. with the jury present. ADA McKinley calls Colleen Leoni to the stand. S/T Colleen L. Direct by ADA McKinley. PL Exhibit #11 (restraining order). O/R Exhibit #11. Permission to publish to the jury granted. PL Exhibit #12 (copy of e-mail). O/R Exhibit #12. PL Exhibit #13(e-mail from Mr. Leoni). O/R Exhibit #13. PL Exhibit #14(e-mail from Mr. Leoni). Permission to publish 12,13 and 14 granted. Cross by Atty Harrelson. DE Exhibit #4 (Transcript). DE Exhibit #1(stipulation and order). O/R Exhibit #1. Witness excused at 1:46 p.m. State rests at 1:46 p.m. Jury excused at 1:46 p.m. On the record outside the presence of the jury at 1:47 p.m. O/R Exhibit #14. Court will reserve on Exhibit #4. Atty Harrelson makes Motion to Dismiss the case. Court at this time will deny the motion. Court recesses at 1:50 p.m. Case recalled at 2:04 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Atty Harrelson states that his client will testify. Court reviews defendant's rights in regards to testifying. Atty Harrelson reviews pros and cons with defendant in regards to testifying. Defendant will waive his right to remain silent. Court will find that defendant knowingly and voluntairly waives his right to remain silent. On the record and jury present at 2:13 p.m. Atty Harrelson calls Leticia F. to the stand. S/T Leticia F. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Refers to Exhibits #12, #13 and #14. Cross by ADA McKinley. Witness excused at 2:31 p.m. Atty Harrelson calls Amadeo Leoni to the stand. S/T Amadeo Leoni. Direct by Atty Harrelson. Refers to Exhibits #12, #13 and #14. DE Exhibit #3 (partial marital settlement agreement). O/R Exhibit #3. Atty Harrelson requesting permission to publish to the jury. Court grants. DE Exhibit #2 (divorce decree). O/R Exhibit #2. Permission granted to publish paragraph 10. Cross by ADA McKinley. Redirect by Atty Harrelson. No further witnesses by defense. No rebuttal by the state. Jury excused at 3:09 p.m. Case recalled at 4:10 p.m. outside the presence of the jury. Court and parties discuss Verdict forms. No objection by either party. Court reviews jury instructions. No objection by either party. Atty Harrelson requesting status of DE Exhibit #4. Court will admit into evidence. Atty Harrelson brings forth Motion to Dismiss. Court will deny motion. Case recalled at 4:22 p.m.  with the jury present. Court reads jury instructions. Closing argument by ADA McKinley at 4:36 p.m. Closing argument by Atty Harrelson at 4:48 p.m. Rebuttal at 5:05 pm. Jury instructions. 5:12 - Oath to Bailiff. Jury excused at 5:15 pm. Outside the presence of the jury - no objections re: reading of the jury instructions. 5:50 - Jury questions reviewed outside the presence of the jury. Jury would like to return tomorrow at 8:15 am. Jury in at 5:52 pm. Court addresses jury. Adjourned at 5:53 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Amadeo Nmi Leoni appeared. Case called at 8:49 a.m. ADA McKinley requesting this hearing for the court to hear the Motions in Limine before the date of trial. Court did receive 2 sets of motions. One by the state and one by the defense. ADA McKinley brings up an issue regarding discovery. Requested transcripts by Atty Harrelson and has not received them yet. Court will hear defenses motions first. Motion #1 Granted. Motion #2 Granted regarding sequestration of witnesses. Motion #3 regarding heresay, court will reserve on and take up on a case by case basis. Motion #4 has been complied with. Motion #5 is granted. Motion #6 regarding transcript of trial. Everything is taken down. Motion #7 is the courts practice. Motion #8 is the courts practice. Written jury instructions are provided to jurors. Motion #9 and #10 pertains to Motion #2. Motions #11 and #12 have been complied with by the state. Court will reserve on Motion #13 regarding on officer's memo books. Motion #14 court will reserve on. Motion #15 has been complied with. Motion #16 will be taken up on a case by case basis. Atty Harrelson would like the Bill in Particulars be addressed. Makes argument. Court will deny the motion. Court will hear the state's motions. Motion #1 Granted in the event that defendant testifies. Motion #2. Atty Harrelson objects. Court will reserve on Motion #2. ADA McKinley argues any oral consent be relevant. Court will reserve on that. Motion #3 reserved. Motion #4. Atty Harrelson gives objection. Court will prohibit the state from introducing evidence on the June 9th incident. June 21, 2014 incident is admissible. Court will not get into the language of the jury instruction today. ADA McKinley requesting to introducing the TRO into evidence but will redact the penalties.  Court will order any penalty be redacted from the TRO. Court does not feel like the defense needs to provide transcripts to the state. Will report tomorrow at 8:30 a.m.
Amended. Filed by ADA McKinley.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on April 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Colleen L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO; Proctor for HWC, RPR; Erin Drost, ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler,   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea for today only,  DF:  Amadeo Nmi Leoni appeared.  Defendant does not qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Reserve on motions. Defendant has an appointment with Atty Harrelson. Refund cash bond to payor.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.
